trans-unit.source: Posted Sales Invoice Line List

trans-unit.source: Specifies the line type.

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control FilteredTypeField - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies the type of transaction that was posted with the line.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control FilteredTypeField - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of the involved entry or record, according to the specified number series.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control No. - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the cross-referenced item number. If you enter a cross reference between yours and your vendor's or customer's item number, then this number will override the standard item number when you enter the cross-reference number on a sales or purchase document.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Cross-Reference No. - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the code of the intercompany partner that the transaction is related to if the entry was created from an intercompany transaction.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control IC Partner Code - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the variant of the item on the line.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Variant Code - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the item or general ledger account, or some descriptive text.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Description - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the code explaining why the item was returned.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Return Reason Code - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of units of the item specified on the line.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Quantity - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies how each unit of the item or resource is measured, such as in pieces or hours. By default, the value in the Base Unit of Measure field on the item or resource card is inserted.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Unit of Measure Code - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the item or resource's unit of measure, such as piece or hour.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Unit of Measure - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the cost, in LCY, of one unit of the item or resource on the line.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Unit Cost (LCY) - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the price of one unit of the item or resource. You can enter a price manually or have it entered according to the Price/Profit Calculation field on the related card.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Unit Price - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies if the customer or vendor is liable for sales tax.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Tax Liable - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the tax area that is used to calculate and post sales tax.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Tax Area Code - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the tax group that is used to calculate and post sales tax.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Tax Group Code - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the discount percentage that is granted for the item on the line.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Line Discount % - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the net amount, excluding any invoice discount amount, that must be paid for products on the line.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Line Amount - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the discount amount that is granted for the item on the line.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Line Discount Amount - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the invoice line could have been included in a possible invoice discount calculation.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Allow Invoice Disc. - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of the related job.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Job No. - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of the related job task.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Job Task No. - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the entry number of the job planning line that the sales line is linked to.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Job Contract Entry No. - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of the item ledger entry that the document or journal line is applied to.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Appl.-to Item Entry - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the reason code on the entry.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Reason Code - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the deferral template that governs how revenue earned with this sales document is deferred to the different accounting periods when the good or service was delivered.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Deferral Code - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the code for Shortcut Dimension 1, which is one of two global dimension codes that you set up in the General Ledger Setup window.
trans-unit.note: Page Posted Sales Inv. Subform List - Control Shortcut Dimension 1 Code - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the code for Shortcut Dimension 2, which is one of two global dimension codes that you set up in the General Ledger Setup window.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the line type.

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control FilteredTypeField - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies the type of transaction that will be posted with the document line. If you select Comment, then you can enter any text in the Description field, such as a message to a customer.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control FilteredTypeField - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of a general ledger account, an item, an additional cost or a fixed asset, depending on what you selected in the Type field.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control No. - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the cross-referenced item number. If you enter a cross reference between yours and your vendor's or customer's item number, then this number will override the standard item number when you enter the cross-reference number on a sales or purchase document.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Cross-Reference No. - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the code of the intercompany partner that the transaction is related to if the entry was created from an intercompany transaction.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control IC Partner Code - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the item or account in your IC partner's company that corresponds to the item or account on the line.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control IC Partner Ref. Type - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the IC partner. If the line is being sent to one of your intercompany partners, this field is used together with the IC Partner Ref. Type field to indicate the item or account in your partner's company that corresponds to the line.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control IC Partner Reference - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the variant of the item on the line.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Variant Code - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies that this item is a catalog item.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Nonstock - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the VAT product posting group. Links business transactions made for the item, resource, or G/L account with the general ledger, to account for VAT amounts resulting from trade with that record.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control VAT Prod. Posting Group - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Description/Comment
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Description - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies a description of the entry of the product to be purchased. To add a non-transactional text line, fill in the Description field only.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Description - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the code explaining why the item was returned.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Return Reason Code - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the code for the location where the items on the line will be located.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Location Code - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the bin where the items are picked or put away.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Bin Code - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of units of the item specified on the line.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Quantity - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies how each unit of the item or resource is measured, such as in pieces or hours. By default, the value in the Base Unit of Measure field on the item or resource card is inserted.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Unit of Measure Code - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the unit of measure for the item, such as 1 bottle or 1 piece.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Unit of Measure - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the cost of one unit of the selected item or resource.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the percentage of the item's last purchase cost that includes indirect costs, such as freight that is associated with the purchase of the item.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Indirect Cost % - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the unit cost of the item on the line.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Unit Cost (LCY) - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the price for one unit of the item.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Unit Price (LCY) - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies if the customer or vendor is liable for sales tax.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the tax area that is used to calculate and post sales tax.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Tax Area Code - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the tax group that is used to calculate and post sales tax.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Tax Group Code - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies that the purchase is subject to use tax. Use tax is a sales tax that is paid on items that are purchased by a company and are used by that company instead of being sold to a customer.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the discount percentage that is granted for the item on the line.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Line Discount % - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the net amount, excluding any invoice discount amount, that must be paid for products on the line.

trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Job Unit Price - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the line amount of the job ledger entry that is related to the purchase line.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Job Line Amount - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the line discount amount of the job ledger entry that is related to the purchase line.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the gross amount of the line that the purchase line applies to.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the sales price per unit that applies to the item or general ledger expense that will be posted.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Job Unit Price (LCY) - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Specifies the gross amount of the line, in the local currency.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the line amount of the job ledger entry that is related to the purchase line.
trans-unit.note: Page Purch. Invoice Subform List - Control Job Line Amount (LCY) - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Suggest Vendor Payments
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Options
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control Options - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Find Payments
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control Find Payments - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Last Payment Date
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control LastPaymentDate - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies the latest payment date that can appear on the vendor ledger entries to be included in the batch job. Only entries that have a due date or a payment discount date before or on this date will be included. If the payment date is earlier than the system date, a warning will be displayed.
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control LastPaymentDate - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Find Payment Discounts
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control FindPaymentDiscounts - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies if you want the batch job to include vendor ledger entries for which you can receive a payment discount.
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control FindPaymentDiscounts - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Use Vendor Priority
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control UseVendorPriority - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies if the Priority field on the vendor cards will determine in which order vendor entries are suggested for payment by the batch job. The batch job always prioritizes vendors for payment suggestions if you specify an available amount in the Available Amount (LCY) field.
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control UseVendorPriority - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Available Amount (LCY)
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control Available Amount (LCY) - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies a maximum amount (in LCY) that is available for payments. The batch job will then create a payment suggestion on the basis of this amount and the Use Vendor Priority check box. It will only include vendor entries that can be paid fully.
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control Available Amount (LCY) - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Skip Exported Payments
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control SkipExportedPayments - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies if you do not want the batch job to insert payment journal lines for documents for which payments have already been exported to a bank file.
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control SkipExportedPayments - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Check Other Journal Batches
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control CheckOtherJournalBatches - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether to exclude payments that are already included in another journal batch from new suggested payments. This helps avoid duplicate payments.
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control CheckOtherJournalBatches - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Summarize Results
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control Summarize Results - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Summarize per Vendor
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control SummarizePerVendor - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies if you want the batch job to make one line per vendor for each currency in which the vendor has ledger entries. If, for example, a vendor uses two currencies, the batch job will create two lines in the payment journal for this vendor. The batch job then uses the Applies-to ID field when the journal lines are posted to apply the lines to vendor ledger entries. If you do not select this check box, then the batch job will make one line per invoice.
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control SummarizePerVendor - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: By Dimension
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control SummarizePerDimText - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies the dimensions that you want the batch job to consider.
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control SummarizePerDimText - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Fill in Journal Lines
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control Fill in Journal Lines - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Posting Date
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control PostingDate - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies the date for the posting of this batch job. By default, the working date is entered, but you can change it.
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control PostingDate - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Calculate Posting Date from Applies-to-Doc. Due Date
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control UseDueDateAsPostingDate - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies if the due date on the purchase invoice will be used as a basis to calculate the payment posting date.
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control UseDueDateAsPostingDate - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Applies-to-Doc. Due Date Offset
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control DueDateOffset - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies a period of time that will separate the payment posting date from the due date on the invoice. Example 1: To pay the invoice on the Friday in the week of the due date, enter CW-2D (current week minus two days). Example 2: To pay the invoice two days before the due date, enter -2D (minus two days).
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control DueDateOffset - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Starting Document No.
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control StartingDocumentNo - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies the next available number in the number series for the journal batch that is linked to the payment journal. When you run the batch job, this is the document number that appears on the first payment journal line. You can also fill in this field manually.
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control StartingDocumentNo - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: New Doc. No. per Line
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control NewDocNoPerLine - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies if you want the batch job to fill in the payment journal lines with consecutive document numbers, starting with the document number specified in the Starting Document No. field.
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control NewDocNoPerLine - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Bal. Account Type
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control BalAccountType - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: G/L Account,,,Bank Account
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control BalAccountType - Property OptionCaption

trans-unit.source: Specifies the balancing account type that payments on the payment journal are posted to.
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control BalAccountType - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Bal. Account No.
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control BalAccountNo - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies the balancing account number that payments on the payment journal are posted to.
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control BalAccountNo - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Bank Payment Type
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control BankPaymentType - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies selection of the bank payment type (check type) you are using in case you use bank account as the balancing account type.
trans-unit.note: Report Suggest Vendor Payments OP - Control BankPaymentType - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Starting Date
trans-unit.note: Report OP Calc. and Post VAT Stlmt. - Control StartingDate - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies the first date in the period from which VAT entries are processed in the batch job.
trans-unit.note: Report OP Calc. and Post VAT Stlmt. - Control StartingDate - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Ending Date
trans-unit.note: Report OP Calc. and Post VAT Stlmt. - Control EndDateReq - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies the last date in the period from which VAT entries are processed in the batch job.
trans-unit.note: Report OP Calc. and Post VAT Stlmt. - Control EndDateReq - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Posting Date
trans-unit.note: Report OP Calc. and Post VAT Stlmt. - Control PostingDt - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies the date on which the transfer to the VAT account is posted. This field must be filled in.
trans-unit.note: Report OP Calc. and Post VAT Stlmt. - Control PostingDt - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Document No.
trans-unit.note: Report OP Calc. and Post VAT Stlmt. - Control DocumentNo - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies a document number. This field must be filled in.
trans-unit.note: Report OP Calc. and Post VAT Stlmt. - Control DocumentNo - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Settlement Account
trans-unit.note: Report OP Calc. and Post VAT Stlmt. - Control SettlementAcc - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of the VAT settlement account. Select the field to see the chart of account. This field must be filled in.
trans-unit.note: Report OP Calc. and Post VAT Stlmt. - Control SettlementAcc - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.note: Report OP Calc. and Post VAT Stlmt. - Control RoundingGLAccount - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.note: Report OP Calc. and Post VAT Stlmt. - Control RoundingAmount - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Show VAT Entries
trans-unit.note: Report OP Calc. and Post VAT Stlmt. - Control ShowVATEntries - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies if you want the report that is printed during the batch job to contain the individual VAT entries. If you do not choose to print the VAT entries, the settlement amount is shown only for each VAT posting group.
trans-unit.note: Report OP Calc. and Post VAT Stlmt. - Control ShowVATEntries - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Post
trans-unit.note: Report OP Calc. and Post VAT Stlmt. - Control Post - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies if you want the program to post the transfer to the VAT settlement account automatically. If you do not choose to post the transfer, the batch job only prints a test report, and Test Report (not Posted) appears on the report.
trans-unit.note: Report OP Calc. and Post VAT Stlmt. - Control Post - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Show Amounts in Add. Reporting Currency
trans-unit.note: Report OP Calc. and Post VAT Stlmt. - Control AmtsinAddReportingCurr - Property Caption

trans-unit.source: Specifies if the reported amounts are shown in the additional reporting currency.
trans-unit.note: Report OP Calc. and Post VAT Stlmt. - Control AmtsinAddReportingCurr - Property ToolTip

trans-unit.source: Performance Country
